entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To blame, disparage. 2. To boast, show off one's self (smod) CD. 1. To lower, make low. 2. To abuse, revile, blame, chide. 3. To dishonor, violate, ravish (smad) CD. To dishonor, to reprove, make low DK. 1. To speak vilely to a person. 2. To lower, bring lower DS. 1. To speak with course words, ridicule, jeer TC. 2. To bring down, make lower TC.
entry.note: Note:(Stein 1942: 205) suggests comparison with several words (see note at smo).

entry.trans: Meaning: To bless, wish, desire (others to be happy and prosperous). 2. (with terminative of the infinitive) To pray for CD. To bless, wish, desire, admire, like DK. To have a very good wish, hope DS. To desire to obtain TC.
entry.note: Note: (Stein 1942: 205) suggests comparison with the following words: smo 'say', smod 'blame' dmod 'imprecation, malediction, prayer' smon lam 'prayer'. I suggest also possibly mo 'divination.'.

entry.trans: Meaning: To have new relations by marriage, to marry DK. To pollinate (Goldstein 2001).
Meaning: To dip in, to immerse CD. To put in, to insert, to let to do [sic] DK. To make longer (a spear, rope &c.) DS.
Meaning: To fast, to observe a scant diet CD. To lead an ascetic life, to fast DK. To endure the suffering thirst and hunger for a certain period of time DS. 1. To be hungry. 2. To make fewer TC.
entry.note: Note: For TC.'s def. 2 compare snyung.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To stretch one's self after sleep (Sch.). 2. To be quick, expeditious, in a hurry, to hasten CD. To make time shorter, to anticipate DK. To be quick, hasten DS. (archaic) To take short time. 2. To make nearer TC.

Meaning: To be insane, inflamed with insanity CD. To become made DK. To have a nervous disease and look for intelligence DS. To be mentally confused, for the mind not to stay calm, not to stay natural TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To speak, utter, say CD. To speak, say, tell DK. To speak, tell DS. To tell, speak TC.
Meaning: (archaic) To speak CD. 1. To speak. 2. To hide DK. 1. (in some dialects) To be sad. 2. To hide, keep secret. 3. To speak, say DS. (archaic) To say, tell speak TC.
Meaning: To speak ill of CD. To utter lamentations, to lament, bewail DK. To speak badly, vilely DS.

Meaning: To thrust in, poke, piece, prick CD. To eat out, to cut into halves, to take out, to let out blood from a vein DK. 1. To prick, stab, jab (with a knife, lance, needle). 2. To sew (with needle and thread) DS. To slice, bleed, bring out after cutting TC.
Meaning: To detach with a crowbar (JÃ¤) (gtsab) CD. To cut small, to chop, mince (btsab) CD. To cut into small pieces, chop, mince DK. To cut in pieces (with a knife, axe &c.) DS. To cut finely TC.
Meaning: 1. To delight in, set store by, be fond of. 2. To invite, summon, call, appoint (Sch.) CD. To take care of, look after, to respect, venerate DS.
Meaning: To grin DK. To show teeth because of hatred and pain DK. To bear teeth TC.
Meaning: 1. To plant. 2. To bore out, scoop out, excavate (Sch.) CD.
entry.note: Note: Compare 'dzug and the note thereto.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To rub. 2. To churn CD. To rub, to make friction, to drag, move DK. 1. To rub against, to create friction. 2. To raise dust by moving something to and fro DS. To rub, scrape, grind TC.
Meaning: To make unhappy (e.g. the ears) DS. To irritate, harm the ears TC.
Meaning: To enforce strictly DK. (for a situation) To be strict, dire (Hoshi 2003).

Meaning: To play, frolic, disport one's self, take recreation, play games CD. To play games DK. To play (a game, an opera &c.) DS. To play music, play a game TC.

To speak about the size of a price DS. 1. To place one on top of another. 2. To be restricted (as the breath). 3. To raise, increase (e.g. a price) TC.
Meaning: To tuck up, truss up CD. To push up one's dress, to pull up DK. 1. To rise, stand. 2. To lift up DS. To lift, raise TC.

Meaning: To take delight in games, to enjoy, romanticize DK. 1. To raise up, elevate, float, hover, soar. 2. To play a game DS. (archaic) 1. To play music, play a game. 2. To rest, stay, remain. 3. To raise up, elevate, float, hover, soar TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To begin anything, to set about an undertaking, to start. 2. To practice, to accomplish. 3. To compose, draw up in writing CD. 1. To compose, to write a book. 2. To prepare DK. 1. To compose a śāstra. 2. To prepare. 3. To start, begin DS. 1. To write, compose (the words of a book &c.) 2. To undertake an action TC.
Meaning: To endeavor, to take pain CD. To try, to endeavor, to tighten DK. To exert, strive for DS. To strive, endeavor TC.
Meaning: To remove, purify (= sel) CD. To remove, get rid of DK. (archaic equivalent of sel) To remove, purify DS, TC.
Meaning: To earn, accumulate, save for future DK.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To give, grant, bestow, confer. 2. To restore CD. To give helps, grant, send, order DK. (honorific) To give DS. 1. (honorific) To give, do. 2. To begin an action TC. (mchid stsal pa) To give a letter (from someone higher to lower) (Takeuchi 1990b: 178-183).
Meaning: To welcome, receive (a guest) CD. To welcome, to receive with welcome DK. (archaic) To welcome, receive (= bsu) DS, TC.
Meaning: (usually preceded by snying or thugs) To love CD. To have affection, to love DK. To love, be affectionate DS. To love be fond of TC.
Meaning: To cause some uneasiness with one's teeth by friction or friction sounds DK. For a characteristic pain of contact to arise DS. To be difficult, unbearable TC.
Meaning: For hooves (of horses, mules &c.) to wear down, and because of becoming near the flesh, to be painful on touch TC.
Meaning: To strive, aim at, exert one's self for CD. To try hard, to endeavor DK. To strive gladly without respite DS. To try, to strive TC.
Meaning: To be hot CD. To feel hot, to be hot DK. To ache, burn (of a pain) TC.

Meaning: To be complete, full, entire CD. To be completed, the entire, number of requirements, to be completed the entire body of something [sic] DK. For a number or measure to be complete, for all pieces to come together, be assembled DS. For a number, measure to be complete, come together TC.
Meaning: To be clean, pure CD. To be clean, to feel clean DK.
Meaning: To measure, complete DK. To measure (weight, length, quantity &c.) DS. To compare, measure (length &c.) TC.
Meaning: To fulfill, finish, to be finished, completed, spent CD. To finish, to complete DK. To end, finish, complete, perfect DS. To finish, complete TC.

Meaning: To be contented, satisfied, satiated, consoled CD. To be contented, to be satisfied DK. 1. To have eaten enough, be full, sated. 2. For a wish to be fulfilled DS. To be satisfied, to be content TC.
Meaning: To be able DK, DS.
Meaning: To do harm, to hurt, to inflict (JÃ¤) CD. To harm, hurt TC.
Meaning: To dig CD.
Meaning: 1. To be exhausted from work. 2. To suffer, to be busy DS.
Meaning: To be bend down, to be turned away [CD], DK.
Meaning: To have the disadvantage, to come off the loser, not receiving a full share (Sch.) CD.
Meaning: To rise (the moon &c.) DK. 1. For a month to start. 2. For the light of the moon to spread DS. To shine TC.
Meaning: To assemble, gather CD. 1. To hold, contain, retain. 2. To gather, assemble TC.
Meaning: 1. To doubt, hesitate. 2. To be timid, bashful, shy. 3. To be ashamed (Cs.) (JÃ¤) CD. To doubt, to not be resolute DS.
entry.note: Note:CD writes tsoms in Tibetan but transcribes tshoms.

entry.trans: Meaning: To perceive, to feel CD. To perceive through touching, to feel, understand DK. For sensation or outer conditions to give rise to direct experience DS. To feel, understand, know TC.
Meaning: 1. To be ready, to have cooked enough (of food). 2. To ripen (the fruits of trees and plants) DS. To become soft from cooking TC.
Meaning: To ornament, to put on, to wear, to wonder DK. 1. For a mark or sign to be placed upon something. 2. To dress, adorn, decorate DS. To dress, adorn, decorate TC.
Meaning: To wonder, to feel strange DK.
Meaning: To be alike, similar DK. 1. To be similar to one another (for different things). 2. To have the same meaning DS.

Meaning: To grieve, to sorrow CD. To displease, to hesitate, to be ashamed, to be displeased DK. To become sad, regretful DS. 1. To be irritated, to not want to act. 2. To be embarrassed, ashamed, afraid TC.

Meaning: To set forth, bring forward, show, quote, exhibit CD. To comprehend by a sign or hint, to indicate DK. 1. To symbolize, signify. 2. To set forth an example DS. To clarify, to show, to make understand TC.
Meaning: To hesitate, be reluctant DK. To finish making preparations DS. To save, accumulate TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To cause to trickle, to strain, filter, press out CD. To sift, separate by putting through a sieve, to sift tea, to filter DK. For something gross to become fine from being draw through a strainer, for sediment to settle from liquid DS. For sediment to settle from liquid TC.
Meaning: To press into, to stuff, puff out CD. To rush in, to enter hostilely, violently DK. To be put carefully into many categories DS. To look about and then enter TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To press into, to stuff, puff out ('tshang) CD. To press forward, press into, squeeze one's self in (btsang) CD. To put in, to insert DK. To put something in a vessel DS. To put forcibly in between, to insert with force TC.
Meaning: To have difficulty breathing, to be stuffed up TC.
Meaning: (honorific) To be afraid, to be in awe of CD. To be frightened, to be afraid of, to be nervous DK. To not be confident DS. To be agitated, afraid TC.
Meaning: To repay, replace CD. To repay the loss of another's property DS. 1. To repay, replace. 2. To add, augment TC.
Meaning: To suit, to be suitable DK. To be alright, suitable, to be in accord DS. To be fitting, to be in accord TC.
Meaning: To harm, compete, challenge CD. To make trouble, fight, abuse, mistreat TC.
Meaning: To grow up, to become taller, to develop DK. To grow larger, increase TC.

entry.function: Function: To denote an action that is perfectly past or completed CD.

entry.trans: Meaning: To greet, to prostrate for respect DK. (when prefixed by phyag) To pay respect, be respectful DS. To do (e.g. phyag 'tshal 'prostrate') TC.

Meaning: 1. To beg, desire, ask. 2. (honorific) To eat. 3. To offer, show, set forth CD. 1. (archaic) To know. 2. (archaic) To take food DS. 1. To be acceptable, allowed. 2. To wish for, want. 3. To be necessary. 4. To know. 5. (archaic) To explain. 6. (archaic) To eat TC.

entry.function: Function: (when preceded by a verb the latter stands in the terminative infinitive or as the mere root and more especially the perfect root) To beg, desire, ask CD. (suffixed to the present stem of a verb) To exhort, encourage DS.

entry.trans: Meaning: To burn, to destroy by fire, to flow CD. To burn, to feel hot DK. To become of another nature once burned by fire (for wood &c.) DS. To naturally become burnt TC.

Meaning: To extract, wring out, squeeze forth, to press out oil, extracts CD. To wring out, to squeeze, to contract by pressing, to extract or press out oil &c. by wringing out DK. To press from two sides DS. 1. To push in a gap. 2. To carefully examine TC.
Meaning: To be squeezed, to be contracted, to come out, trickle down DK.
Meaning: To not be in a pleasant state of mind DS.

Meaning: 1. To go into, to enter upon, begin commence. 2. To pierce, penetrate by boring, to thrust in, to establish one's self, to settle CD. To begin, to be founded DK. To start, begin DS. To stay firm, to hold one's ground TC.
Meaning: To be put inside of, to go into, to enter, to get into CD. To be included, to be involved DK. To classify DS. 1. To come inside, be classified. 2. To fit, contain, have room TC.

Meaning: To toss about, to swirl, to entwine, be choked, suffocated CD. To swirl (snow, dust, wind, water, &c.), to be suffocated, choked, overflow DK. 1. To gather, mass, billow (dust, smell &c.). 2. To wheeze, breath with difficulty DS. To be chaotic, growl, shake, disturbed TC.
Meaning: To cause mischief or danger to, to damage, injure, persecute CD. To harm, to bring evil DK. To harm, to instigate a quarrel DS. To harm, annoy TC.
Meaning: To repay a loan, kindness CD.

Meaning: To be satisfied, content, happy, gratified CD. To be satisfied, to be happy, to win, overcome DK. To be satisfied, establish as a hope DS. 1. To be satisfied, happy. 2. To gain profit, to be victorious TC.

Meaning: 1. To assemble, to meet together. 2. To unite, to join in doing something, to combine, to make common cause (JÃ¤) CD. To assemble, to get together DK. To assemble many things together DS. To gather together TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To go down, dwindle, be consumed, to come to and end CD. To finish, perfect DS. To reach and end, finish, perfect TC.
Meaning: To count on the beads, to mutter charms, to pronounce CD. To recite mantras, to repeat, mutter mantras DK.
Meaning: To waste DS. To go to waste TC.
Meaning: To hang down, to be left DK. For water to slowly drip from wet wool which is hung up DS. To hang down TC.
Meaning: 1. To take dinner at midday. 2. To dress carelessly, or in a loose manner, to huddle on clothes or rags CD.
Meaning: 1. To be busy about, to be engaged in, to be taken up with, absorbed by anything. 2. To abstain from, to be abstinent, temperate (Sch.) CD. To abstain, quite, be temperate DS.
Meaning: To dispute, quarrel, contend with, wrestle, struggle with CD. To dispute, to quarrel, to fight, to struggle DK. To fight, quarrel DS. To fight TC.
Meaning: To mix, juxtapose, intertwine DS. To mix, shake, be agitated TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: (frequently requiring nas attached to the object seized) To lay hold of, to seize, grasp CD. To hold, keep DK. To take an object (with hands, claws &c.) DS. 1. To hold. 2. To take, seize TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To trickle off, to let drip CD. To trickle down, drip DK. To drip down from a hole or crack DS. To drip TC.
Meaning: To catch at, to seize on. 2. To enter (Sch.) CD.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To thrust a stick into, push down, to set a plant in the ground, to set down, to set up a pillar, to raise (a standard). 2. To establish, found, settle, introduce. 3. To sting (like nettles), to prick CD. 1. To plant. 2. To firmly put at the foot or peak of a thing. 3. To newly establish. 4. (with 'go) To start an action. 5. (with a weapon) To jab, strike, prick. 6. To accuse DS.
entry.note: Note:(Hahn 1995: 142) suggests that a secondary form of gzug(s). gtsug is the first member of the noun gtsug lag. Compare also gtsug.

entry.trans: Meaning: To put, to lead, to guide, to induce, to insert CD. To insert, to put in, admit it DK. To put into, cause to go DS. To make go in TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To smile CD. To smile, to part the lips slightly DK. To smile, laugh a bit DS. To smile, laugh a little TC.
Meaning: To close, shut (eyes, mouth) CD. To close, to shut up, one's mouth, &c. DK. The close (the mouth, eye &c.) DS. To close (mouth, eyes) TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To give way, to draw back, (of a horse) to shy CD. To avoid, turn away (an arrow &c.) DS. To avoid, shun TC.
Meaning: To pass, elapse (time) CD.
Meaning: To glide, steal out, away CD. To go inside and thus become obfuscated, hidden. 2. To descend into DS. To insert, to place into TC.
Meaning: To climb up to ascend, to walk up CD. To climb up, to ascend, to walk up DK. To go from a low place to a high one DS. To go upward TC.
Meaning: 1. To fight with projectiles, to throw stones. 2. To stick, jut out, to project, to be prominent (Sch.) CD.
Meaning: To hold out, forth CD. To take something offered into the palm of a hand, or lip of a vessel DS. To present in the direction of the lip of a vessel TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To shrink from, to shun, avoid CD. To be ashamed, to hesitate, to avoid DK. 1. To control, restrict oneself. 2. To shy away, avoid, protect oneself. 3. To be suspicious, careful, concerned DS. 1. To be careful, wary. 2. To be timid, anxious, shy TC.
Meaning: (archaic) To say, speak CD. To speak, to say DK. (archaic) To say DS. (archaic) 1. To say. 2. To impose TC.
Meaning: (dialect) To pierce, lance DS. (archaic) To pierce TC.
Meaning: (archaic) To be hoarse CD. To be hoarse, for one's voice to become bad DK. To be unable to speak, speak with difficulty TC.
Meaning: To cause to become hoarse, to cause to be rough and harsh of voice DK.

entry.trans: Meaning: To come, approach together, to meet, to interlace CD. To come together, get together, to assemble DK. 1. To gather in one place. 2. To be complete, be full. 3. To meet, encounter, touch DS. 1. To gather, come together. 2. To be complete, full TC.
Meaning: 1. To mistake. 2. To shake about, to stir, intermix, confuse CD. To be mistaken, to be confused, to fall into a wrong track DK. To make a mistake, be confused, be mistaken TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To give a deceptive representation, to make a thing appear different from what it is, to change into, to change (one's self), to be changed CD. To pretend, disguise, feign DK. To change from previous, to appear differently DS. To change, to make something be what it is not TC.
Meaning: To tell lies, to say something with the intention of deceiving, to say the opposite thing DK. To be wrong, to be false (Hackett 2003).

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To tuck up, truss up (clothes), to cock a hat, to turn up the upper lip (JÃ¤). 2. To threaten (Cs.) CD. To turn up, tuck up, to cock up DK. To roll up, lift up (a flap of cloth &c.) DS. To draw up TC.
Meaning: To finish, fulfill, to complete, to terminate CD. To be completed, to be included, to finish, to terminate DK. To reach an end, be complete DS. 1. To fill, complete. 2. To end, finish TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To forward, send off, dispatch, to take along with CD. To send off, send, dispatch, to put in, insert DK. 1. To send, send off, convey, commission (a guest &c.). 2. To put something inside a vessel DS. 1. To banish, expel. 2. To send, dispatch, commission. 3. To insert TC.
Meaning: To spoil, stain TC.
Meaning: To appear as real, to hide the reality with an artificial appearance, to mix up DK. 1. To add, augment. 2. To conceal, obscure, veil TC.
Meaning: To become one-eyed, be defective [on] one side of a pair CD. To go blind, be blinded DS. To go blind, for an eye to be lost or damaged TC.
Meaning: To plaster with lime or cement, to plaster, or overlay with anything (e.g. butter) CD. To spread (mud &c.) thickly DS.

Meaning: 1. To be peaceful, calm, to be pacified, be appeased, to settle be allayed, assuaged &c. 2. To be wise, dispassionate CD. To be, become peaceful, to subdue, make without DK. To disappear DS. To diminish, fade away TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: (used chiefly in addressing one's superiors and also in politeness between equals) To ask, request, beg, petition CD. To inform, request, receive, send DK. To speak a hope, wish &c. to superiors DS. 1. To speak to superiors. 2. To pour, to take (e.g. tea) TC.
Meaning: To melt, become liquid TC.
Meaning: 1. To fit into (e.g. a crowd). 2. To mix inside. 3. To support, link. 4. To follow after DS.

Meaning: 1. [To be] emaciated, to be reduced, to fall, to be weak, grow weak, to dwindle. 2. To twine, to twist, to spin (Cs.). 3. To hang up, to suspend (in Tsang) CD. To decay, to decline DK. To become small, thin, emaciated DS. 1. To hang down, bend down. 2. To deteriorate, weaken TC.
Meaning: (honorific) To cry, weep, lament CD, DS. To become physically weak; to become timid, cowardly DK. To be cowardly TC.
entry.note: Note: This is also written shumDS.

entry.trans: Meaning: To become fewer, less (bloatted, swollen &c.) DS.
Meaning: To fear, be afraid CD. To be frightened, to fear DK. To fear TC.

Meaning: (used with la) To desire, to long for, to be attached to, to have affection for CD. To have attachment, to long for DK. 1. To crave, to cherish. 2. (of a question &c.) To be hard to answer DS. To like, to love TC.
Meaning: For many creatures to be startled and flee DS.

entry.syntax: Syntax: [Abs. Obl.] (Byams pa rdo rje 1996), (Zeisler 2006: 88).[Erg. Abs.] (Hackett 2003), (Zeisler 2006: 88).
entry.trans: Meaning: To ride, mount (A.K. 1-8) CD. To ride, to sit on a horse DK. To ride (a horse, yak, bicycle &c.) DS. To ride TC.
Meaning: To go down, sink down; to be subsided, become under control DK. For a thing with a bulbous form to crumble down, fall apart DS. For a vessel to become flawed, broken TC.
Meaning: To beautify, ornament DK. To ornament, be beautiful [TC].

Meaning: 1. To rub, touch with the hand. 2. To lick (Sch.) CD. To collect in one place many small things which are scattered on the surface of liquid (e.g. butter from milk) DS. 1. To examine skillfully. 2. To ornament, be beautiful [TC].
Meaning: To have difficulty recovering from a wound DS.
Meaning: To hide DS.(archaic) To hide TC.
Meaning: 1. To sport, joke, play, bowl. 2. To believe, trust, confide in CD. (archaic) To delight, be content TC.
Meaning: To shave, shear CD. To shave, cut DK. 1. To shave. 2. To scrape the surface of something DS. 1. To shave. 2. To scrape (gzhar) TC. To cut, shave (bzhar) TC.
Meaning: To make minute inquiry of every point, to investigate, to examine CD. To consider, to be in accordance with DK. To analyze DS. To analyze, examine TC.
entry.note: Note: Root given as *gzyig < *gzig(s) cf. gzigs 'see, look' (Beyer 1992: 84).

entry.trans: Meaning: To put, lay in order (JÃ¤) CD. To associate closely, to stay together, to have a close relation DK.
Meaning: To strike, lash CD. To strike beat DS. To throw, strike, beat TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To attend, to be heedful CD.
Meaning: To go, walk, put into (Sch.) CD.
Meaning: To be very active and attentive, to obey without resistance, to listen to whatever is told DK.
Meaning: To shear, shave, cut of (JÃ¤) CD. To shave DK. To cut, carve (gzhur) TC. To sheer, cut, split (bzhur) TC.
Meaning: To strain, filter (Sch.) CD. To strain, filter, purify DK. To clean, purify (impure water &c.) DS. To strain, purify TC.
Meaning: To light, kindle, inflame (Sch.) CD.
Meaning: To rely on, serve CD.
Meaning: 1. To be well, to prosper. 2. (honorific) To sit, stay, wait (JÃ¤) CD.
Meaning: To cut at, to chip CD. To slice (with a knife &c.) DS.
Meaning: To burn hair with fire DS. To burn TC.
Meaning: To be split, cracked, bruised, dinted CD.
Meaning: To flow down, alight, dismount CD. To come down, dismount DS. To descend, go down, dismount TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To comprehend, fathom, remain fixed absorbed in. 2. To be low, open out to CD. To enter, undergo DK. To strive, exert DS. 1. To strive. 2. To enter, remain TC.
Meaning: 1. To tear, wear (of cloth). 2. (in Central and West) To burst, crack, split (JÃ¤) CD. To be split, cut, to cleave (Gyurme 1992: 261).
Meaning: To laugh, smile (JÃ¤) CD. To laugh, smile DK. (honorific) To laugh DS, TC.
Meaning: To blossom, to develop like a flower (Yig 48) CD. To blossom, grow, develop DK. For the mouth of a flower to open DS. (dialect) For the mouth to open (e.g. a flower) [TC].
Meaning: To moisten, wet DS, TC.

Meaning: (honorific) 1. To sit. 2. To dwell, reside. 3. To remain, stay, exit. 4. (of books) To be recorded in, to be contained CD. (honorific) To sit, remain, live DS. (honorific) To stay, sit, remain TC.
Meaning: (honorific) To start, depart, go away CD. To journey, to set off DK. To go, travel DS. To come, arrive TC.
Meaning: To fall, drip DS.

Meaning: (honorific) To raise, erect, set up, to manufacture, compose (JÃ¤) CD. To erect, to make DK. 1. To erect, make. 2. (honorific) To sing a song DS. (honorific) 1. To newly make, erect. 2. (honorific) To raise, set, establish. 3. (honorific) To sing a song TC.
Meaning: (honorific) To rise, get up CD. To rise DK. To get up, rise DS. (honorific) To get up, rise TC.

Meaning: (honorific) 1. To wish, desire. 2. To propose, maintain, state, assert. 3. To accept, take CD. To promise, assert DS. 1. (honorific) To promise. 2. (honorific) To desire. 3. To know, understand TC.

Meaning: (honorific) 1. To take, receive, accept, seize, confiscate. 2. To take, to eat (JÃ¤) CD. To take, eat, put on, wear DK. (honorific) 1. To eat, drink. 2. (honorific) To promise. 3. To undertake, accept, take for one's own DS. 1. (honorific) To eat, drink, wear. 2. (honorific) To carry, take. 3. (honorific) To think TC.
Meaning: To arrive DS.
Meaning: To itch DK. To become itchy TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To eat CD. To eat, to have food DK. To enjoy food DS. [To eat] TC.
entry.note: Note:(Stein 1942: 205) suggests a relationship with the following words: bza' or gza' 'food', zla 'companion', za (in Dunhuang texts) 'woman', gza' (in Gesar) 'planetary demon', gzan 'to devour, to feed'. To these I add the obvious zas 'food'.

entry.trans: Meaning: To appear, arise DS, TC.
entry.note: Note: The placement of ND here cannot be certain.

entry.trans: Meaning: To become torn, punctured (with a small hole) DS. To fall TC.
Meaning: 1. To finish, end. 2. To indent, leave a mark on top of something DS.
Meaning: To eat, to have food DK.
Meaning: To horripilate TC, (Goldstein 2001). To bear the teeth. To be disheveled (of the hair) (Goldstein 2001).

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To commit to memory. 2. To terminate, be at the end, conclude, be exhausted, be consumed. 3. To be finished, terminated CD. To reach, touch, fall on DK. 1. To obtain having taken. 2. To memorize. 3. To arrive. 4. To suffix, be a suffix to. 5. To know the characteristics of, recognize, discriminate DS. 1. To know well, be certain of. 2. To have been taken, to have taken effect TC.

entry.function: Function: Used in older writings as a perfect affix like tshar denoting that the action is complete and finished CD. If suffixed to the past stem of a verb, it shows the action is finished, complete DS. Helps show the meaning 'finished' TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: (mostly figurative) To bore, force itself into, penetrate, take hold of, permeate CD. 1. To be ill. 2. To penetrate by piercing the outer part of something. 3. To bark DS. 1. To pierce, make a hole. 2. To chew, gnaw (for a dog) TC.
Meaning: To vanish, disappear DK. To block, to vanish, become hidden TC.
Meaning: To close, shut up CD. For the petals of a flower to gather together DS. To close up TC.
Meaning: To fall, to be individually scattered in small pieces DS.
Meaning: To chip a tooth on a small piece of stone or earth inside of food DS.
Meaning: To be meek, timid, humble DS.
Meaning: (later literature and colloquial) To say CD. To say, tell, speak DK. To say DS, TC.
Meaning: (later literature and colloquial) To be named, called CD. To be called, to be named, have the name DS.
Meaning: To be careful, to be alert DK.
Meaning: (undoubtedly a less correct spelling for 'da') To pass, to get beyond (JÃ¤) CD. To free, pass beyond TC.

example.label: Characteristic Example:
example.orth: dmigs bsal gyi bya ba sogs

entry.trans: Meaning: To send word, to report, inform, inquire, ask CD. To question, interrogate DK. (archaic) To call, summon, request DS. To ask, request TC.
Meaning: To pour into, to cast, put in CD. To pour in DK. To pour TC.
Meaning: (archaic) To do, promise DS. (archaic) To do TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To say, tell, express. 2. To murmur. 3. To answer, reply (JÃ¤) CD. To recite, repeat DK. To say, pronounce a phrase again and again DS. 1. To pronounce again and again. 2. To say, speak TC.
entry.note: Note: Although many have bzlas bya'i sngags kyis this spelling is not correct, but bzlas bya does occur in the sense 'to think, ponder, know' LZ. (Beyer 1992: 77) gives the variation between 'do and zlo as evidence of the sound change zl > lz > ld > 'd but he likely relies too heavily on CD. Also compare zlos.

entry.trans: Meaning: To perform in a dance DS.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To cause to return, to drive back, repulse, expel, send back. 2. To send to fetch something. 3. To cause to turn, to divert (e.g. the mind, attention) CD. To turn out, to return, to get rid of DK. To move back, return DS. To stop, make to turn outside, drive away TC.
Meaning: To repeat a charm, spell CD. To repeat, to do the same thing again and again DK. To repeat DS. 1. To arise, spread, emanate. 2. To repeat TC.
Meaning: To spill, drip out from the force of moving to and fro TC.
Meaning: 1. To devour, consume, pick out. 2. To worry CD. 1. To harm. 2. To be careful DK. For feeling, sensation in the mind not to come, arise DS. To harm, threaten TC.
entry.note: Note:(Stein 1942: 205) compares gzan 'devour, feed' with za 'eat', bza / gza 'food, wife' za (Dunhuang) 'woman' and gza' (Gesar) 'planetary demon'.

entry.wrI: Present: gzab LZ, CD, DS, TC.bzab LZ.gzabs CD. 'dzab(s) CD.zab ND.gzob DK, (DS), TC.
entry.example: Characteristic Example:chos spong sogs kyi las la (gzab) LZ.grib dang stabs sogs LZ.mgron la ND.
entry.trans: Meaning: To use care, diligence, beware (gzab) CD. To strive, endeavor, to be studious, to give diligence (Sch.) ('dzabs) CD. To put up one's best, to do carefully DK. To concentrate, be careful, wary DS. To do very well (gzab) TC. To be careful with the mind focused (gzob) TC.
Meaning: To start, begin, prepare DS.
Meaning: To suspend, to hang up, to fling across or over one's shoulder CD. To make hang down DS. To hang over, cover TC.

Meaning: (used with terminative case of the infinitive) 1. To set about, to be on the point, to prepare for. 2. To brandish CD. To raise something for hitting, to prepare, to give DK. To aim for a goal DS. To start, begin, prepare TC.

Meaning: 1. (honorific) To look, see to, regard. 2. To give, grant. 3. To accept, take CD. To look, look after DK. (honorific) To look DS. 1. (honorific) To look. 2. (honorific) To examine, understand TC. To look at (Tournadre & Dorje 2003: 159).
Meaning: 1. (honorific) To see CD. To see DK. (honorific) To see DS. 1. (honorific) To see. 2. (honorific) To examine, understand TC. To see (Tournadre & Dorje 2003: 159).
Meaning: (honorific) To buy CD. (honorific) To buy TC.
Meaning: To cause to bristle; to cause to be disorderly DK. To become disorderly, messed up (of hair) TC.
entry.note: Note: (JÃ¤) gives 'dzings, gzing (used with skra, rarely with mgo) 'bristly, rugged, shaggy', compare also zing, gzeng, and 'dzing.

entry.trans: Meaning: To sleep, to fall asleep CD. To sleep DK. (honorific) To fall asleep, lie down on a bed DS. (honorific) To lie down TC.
Meaning: To suffer, be afflicted, harassed, troubled CD. To harm, hit, aim for hitting DK. To suffer, endure DS. 1. To suffer, be troubled, afflicted. 2. To ready, aim to strike TC.

entry.note: Note: Compare 'dzin, and the note thereto.

entry.trans: Meaning: To horripilate DS. To stretch, lift up TC.
Meaning: 1. To carry. 2. To spit on a stake or spike CD. To hang upon a corner or another extremity, which was hung on an upper extremity DS. To carry TC.
Meaning: 1. To bore into, drive, knock in. 2. To feel pain, to be suffering CD. To begin feeling pain DS.
Meaning: To remember, keep in mind, to show gratitude CD. To repay kindness, be good to, show gratitude DS. To repay a kindness, show gratitude, care for TC.

Meaning: To wake, to rouse from sleep by shaking, to urge on, to hurry on by force CD. To waste, to make no use of, to use without a good purpose DK. To be wasteful (gzon) TC. To be broken, ruined, useless (gson) TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To become drunken, to get intoxicated, stupefied CD. To become intoxicated, to get drunk DK. To be intoxicated, drunk DS, TC.
Meaning: To make, manufacture CD. To construct, build DS. 1. To build, give form to. 2. To become cheap, defective TC.
Meaning: 1. To suffer, bear, endure, resist. 2. To forgive, pardon CD. To bear, tolerate, endure DK. To be able to endure (e.g. hell) DS. To bear, endure, tolerate, be able TC.
Meaning: To bark (of dogs) DS.
Meaning: To collect, sweep together, gather together in ones hands (JÃ¤) CD. To be collected, to close, shut, to collect DK. (archaic) To come together, gather, collect DS.
Meaning: To be noisy, chattering CD. To make humming sounds, to make noise, become noisy DK.
Meaning: 1. To come. 2. To be suitable, practicable, to do. CD. To come, become, be possible DK. 1. To come. 2. To arise, become, obtain DS. To come TC.
entry.note: Note: Compare yong which is an obvious alternate form of the same.

entry.function: Function: (in Central) A future auxiliary CD. 1. A future auxiliary. 2. To be suitable, acceptable TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To become deaf DK. For the power of hearing sound to deteriorate DS. 1. To be unable to hear sound. 2. (archaic) To take, to show TC.
entry.note: Note:TC gives under 'on cig "(archaic) 1. Come, arrive! 2. Give, donate! 3. Carry, take off!"

entry.trans: Meaning: To remove from one place to another, transfer CD. 1. To convey, carry, draw, fetch. 2. (archaic) i. To be discarded, cast off. ii. To protect, shelter TC.
Meaning: To become suitable, to be fitted, eligible DK. (suffixed to a noun) To conform, comply with DS.

entry.function: Function: (with terminative of infinitive, in later times and vulgar with the root) To be worthy, suitable CD. (suffixed to a verb) To be suitable, allowed DS. To be acceptable, suitable, allowed [TC].

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To wander, roam. 2. To be lost. 3. To not appear TC.
Meaning: 1. (in colloquial) To disperse, scatter, send adrift. 2. To ramble, to be scattered (Sch.) CD. To wander, roam about, to be dispersed, scattered DK. To scatter, go off elsewhere TC.

Meaning: (in Old Tibetan contracts) To forfeit, be confiscated (Takeuchi 1995: 185). To shrink, subside, cause diminution, to be displaced CD. To diminish, vanish, disappear DK. 1. To disappear, to become nothing. 2. To suffer a lose DS. To vanish, disappear, become invisible TC.
Meaning: To be beyond limitations, to be endless DK. To be separate, to not be there DS.
Meaning: To be (equative, as opposed to existential yod).

entry.function: Function: For the modern central dialect use as an auxiliary and its egophoric function see (Tournadre & Dorje 2003: 75).

entry.trans: Meaning: To hide oneself CD. To hide, conceal oneself DK. To hide DS, TC.
Meaning: (An involuntary equivalent of the previous verb, or a mistake).
Meaning: (only in West) To strew (salt on food, ashes on the snow) (JÃ¤) CD. To strew, scatter, sprinkle in drops DK.
Meaning: To irrigate, to arrange irrigation canals CD. To canalize, channel DK. To clear away plants and grass in a field DS.
Meaning: To become sleepy, be sleepy DK. To fall asleep DS, TC.
Meaning: To sprinkle CD. To rise up DS. To raise up TC.
Meaning: To not sleep CD. To be cleared, to be without, to be sleepless DK. 1. To be clear, to be cleaned of. 2. To fear, be afraid TC.
Meaning: To become crooked CD. To be crooked, to veer to one side DS. To fall to one side TC.

Meaning: 1. To be patient, to be capable for, equal to. 2. (= 'ong) To come, arrive CD. To come, become, get DK. (dialect for 'ong and 'ongs) To come, arrive DS. 1. To arrive. 2. To arise, occur TC.

entry.function: Function: 1. To occur, be able. 2. For the correct amount to be reached, to be enough, sufficient DS.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To exist. 2. To have.
entry.note: Note: For the function of this verb in Lhasa dialect, and its egophoric use see (Tournadre & Dorje 2003: 90).

entry.trans: Meaning: To gather, heap up DK.
Meaning: To swing, totter, tremble, be unsteady, swinging CD. To be unsteady, to move unsteadily DK.
Meaning: To lean to one side, to be crooked TC.
Meaning: To have past, be done CD. To pass, cross limitations DK. To have finished DS. To pass TC.
Meaning: To itch, to suffer from itchy diseases DK.

Meaning: To shudder, itch CD. To itch, to suffer from itchy diseases DK. 1. To become the flavor and color of rust. 2. To feel the experience of itching. 3. To horripilate DS. 1. To itch. 2. To shake, shudder TC.
entry.note: Note: Compare the nouns g.yan 'itch' and g.ya' 'rust'.

entry.trans: Meaning: To yawn, to gape [CD], DK. To yawn TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To flourish, brandish the hand (alt. for dbyug) CD. To swing hands DK. 1. To throw, hurl away. 2. To get rid of, throw out DS.
Meaning: To outcaste, to cast out CD. To be acquainted with, be stable, to be firm DK. To tame, domesticate, soften TC.
Meaning: To fall asleep DS.
Meaning: To fight, make battle CD.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To swing, waft, flow, agitate, move a thing softly to and fro. 2. To agitate the mind, to turn off the attention to disturb the mind CD. To cause to be idle, to distract (g.yeng) DK. To be idle, to distract one's mind from, to loose one's attention (yeng) DK. 1. To be distracted. 2. To lay out, spread (a cover &c.) DS. To be wild, dispersed (g.yeng) TC. For thoughts to not stay, but move elsewhere (yeng) TC.
Meaning: To float on water DS.
Meaning: To involve in adultery, to have voluntary sexual intercourse with a married person DK. To conduct without manner DS. To have inappropriate conduct TC.
Meaning: 1. To be active, to become conscious, to be awake. 2. To surprise DK. To become clear (of the sky) (Hoshi 2003).

entry.trans: Meaning: To be idle, lazy, slothful CD. To forget, be idle, be lazy DK. 1. To break a promise. 2. To open the mouth of a woolen skirt. 3. To be distracted, lazy DS. 1. To wander, move about. 2. To forget. 3. To be apart from, separate from TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To move about, to swing, flutter (g.yob) CD. To signal, to beckon (g.yab) CD.To wave hands, to wave, to give signal with a hand DK. 1. To swing, flap (a hand, a fan &c.). 2. (colloquial) To couple, have sexual intercourse DS. 1. To make a sign by bending the hand. 2. To draw together in one place TC.
Meaning: To borrow, hire CD. To borrow, lend, hire, give or take loans DK. 1. To use a thing belonging to someone else. 2. To have someone use some thing belonging to oneself DS. To borrow, loan TC.
Meaning: To make something crooked DK. To cover, obscure, block TC.
Meaning: To evade, shun, not go to a place (JÃ¤) [CD]. To avoid, to go aside DK. To go around, to avoid TC.
Meaning: (in West for reg) To feel, perceive CD. To get, obtain DK. To depend, rely on DS. To find, obtain TC.
Meaning: To be delighted, cheerful, joyous CD. To appreciate, to be delightful, to be cheerful, to rejoice DK. To be pleased, happy DS. To appreciate, prefer, be happy TC.

Meaning: To be the time or right moment for anything, to be proper, just right, even CD. To be suitable, to suit DK. 1. To conform, comply, to be fitting, appropriate. 2. For a fixed, determined time to arrive DS. 1. To be appropriate, fitting, conforming. 2. To arrive at a time TC.
Meaning: To tear, to be torn, rent, cleft CD. To be torn, be scattered DK. To destroy, break, scatter DS. To destroy, break, split apart TC.
Meaning: To estimate the worth of something CD. To value, to be worthy of DK. To market at a price DS. To be an appropriate price TC.
entry.note: Note: Compare the adjective rin 'price' and the verb brin 'to market'.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. (with terminative of the substantive) To know, understand. 2. (with terminative of the infinitive) To know that, to perceive CD. To understand, to comprehend, to apprehend DK. To see with the eyes DS. 1. To see. 2. To know, to understand TC.

Meaning: 1. To have the way, manner, custom, quality of. 2. To be necessary, proper, suitable, right, suited to the purpose CD. To be allowable, permissible, suitable DK. To be suitable, proper, allowed DS. To be agreeable, suitable, alright TC.
Meaning: To make haste CD. To be in a hurry, to hasten DK.
Meaning: To grow weak, to deteriorate CD.
Meaning: To fall, to tumble down DK. To roll down, fall down TC.
Meaning: To bend CD. To get together, assemble, bend down DK. To collect together things scattered apart TC.
Meaning: To be fit, capable for, suitable, right CD. To be permissible, to be serviceable, to be eligible DK. To be alright, permissible TC.

entry.function: Function: (suffixed to present of a verb) To be suitable, permissible DS.

entry.trans: Meaning: (archaic) To fall, drop down, crumble, pulverize DS. To crumble, fall down TC.

Meaning: To join, to get together, to collect, to unite, to group DK. 1. To become dark, obscure (of clouds, gloom &c.). 2. To close, tighten the interstices within cracks, splits. 3. To gather many things to one place DS. To close TC.
Meaning: To help through cooperation TC.
Meaning: To heat another by covering with ones own body DS. To huddle up for bodily heat TC.

Meaning: 1. To go bad, to get rotten, to turn rancid. 2. To thaw (of snow) CD. To get rotten, to go bad DK. For the bacteria inside the body of creatures to deteriorate the body DS. To rot, putrefy TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To attain to, to reach. 2. To touch, to come in contact with. 3. (especially in West) To feel, to perceive CD. To touch, to reach, to attain to DK. To touch, contact directly DS. To touch, contact, attain to, reach TC.
Meaning: To cut, to shave DK.
Meaning: To become rigid, stiff, to become hard, become untamable DK. 1. To become solid, stiff. 2. To freeze solid TC.

Meaning: To make ready, accomplish CD. To be DK. For bacteria in a flesh wound to become worse DS. 1. To become worse because of other conditions. 2. To be all right, to be ready. 3. To whither, dry out TC.
Meaning: To be DK, TC.
entry.note: Note: For a description of the use of this verb in modern central dialect see (Tournadre & Dorje 2003: 64).

entry.trans: Meaning: To be strong, vigorous, durable, powerful (of men and animals) CD. To concentrate, to try hard DK. A word which exhorts to do an action rapidly DS. 1. To concentrate on something. 2. To try, exert TC.

Meaning: 1. To amuse, divert one's self, to play and laugh. 2. To take, taste, eat, drink. 3. To practice sorcery, to cause to appear in magical form CD. To enjoy with food or dance, to dance DK. 1. To enjoy, be happy. 2. To magically manifest, hide, disguise. 3. To show ones feelings in dance DS. 1. To enjoy. 2. To eat. 3. To play. 4. To magically manifest TC.
Meaning: To become bodiless CD.

Meaning: To pollute, influence DK.

Meaning: (in Tsang) To cast, overthrow, pull down CD. To make closer in friendly relations, to make friends DK. 1. To trust. 2. To destroy. 3. To expose sins, faults TC.

Meaning: To purge (Cs.) CD. 1. For food to come out through one's anus without digesting. 2. To cause an abortion DK. To dangle downward, to hand down DS. 1. To purge, clean out (the bowels). 2. To come out, leak, drip TC.
Meaning: (archaic) To hand down, dangle down DS, TC.

Meaning: To introductorily explain the meaning of (study, compassion, meditation) DS.

entry.trans: Meaning: (in the phrase byin gyis rlob) To bless CD. To bless, control, influence DK. (a widespread suffix which when connected to the phrase byin gyis means) To change into something else &c. DS. To do, to change TC.
Meaning: For the mind to go evil because of outside circumstances, for a sense faculty to become dull DS. To press or move to evil TC.

Meaning: 1. (used with terminative) To be conceited, to be proud of, to glory in, to boast. 2. To love, to adhere to, to be attached to. 4. To covet CD. 1. To be influenced, corrupted, to hold a perception which exists to not exist. 2. To be proud, covetous TC.
Meaning: To feel proud, to think one's self superior, to feel self-satisfied DK. 1. To be arrogant. 2. To believe DS.
Meaning: To wash CD. To loose, discard, to clean away, clear away TC.
entry.note: Note: Probably not to be separated from rlog.

entry.trans: Meaning: (honorific) To be, become CD. To be DK, DS. (honorific) To be TC.
Meaning: To rise, to get up CD. To get up, stand up DK. 1. To get up. 2. To arise, be born. DS. To get up, stand up, rise TC.
Meaning: To dawn, for day to break DS. To dawn, for day to break TC.
Meaning: To come up to, to arrive at, to be equal, to reach CD. To be finished, complete TC.
Meaning: To become bad from good DS. To deteriorate, become weak TC.
Meaning: (for an accident, misfortune) To happen DS.
Meaning: (colloquial) To speak, talk, tell CD. To speak, say, tell DK. To say what one likes DS. To speak, say, tell TC.
Meaning: To be willing to work DK.
Meaning: 1. To work. 2. To be left. 3. To depend upon DK. (in some dialects) To do work DS. To do TC.
Meaning: To throw up phlegm, to clear the throat CD. To cough, clear ones throat by coughing DK. The circumstance which occurs from feeling of pain in the throat DS. To bring forth phlegm TC.
Meaning: To huddle heads together like timid sheep, to be sheepish in behavior (JÃ¤) CD.
Meaning: To collapse, dangle, hand down TC.
Meaning: To make an article from molten iron placed in a form DS. 1. To pour an impression, cast. 2. To put inside (of something) TC.
Meaning: For a liquid (water &c.) to rise above the lip of a vessel and fall down DS. To rise and overflow TC.
Meaning: To give arrival signals DK.
Meaning: To be left, to remain behind CD. To be left, to depend on DK. 1. To be left over. 2. To remain after finishing DS. To not be finished, not end TC.

entry.note: Note: Probably a verbal use of the adjective legs 'good' ND.

To be of certain mind, be in the mind. 3. To be able, to have power. 4. To draw out, take out. 5. To promise. 6. To sing the words to a song DS. 1. To fetch, pull, take out, draw together. 2. To sing a song TC.
Meaning: 1. To remark disapprovingly. 2. To be eligible, serviceable DK. To be suitable, allowed TC.
entry.note: Definition 1 of DK should be referred to lo2.

entry.function: Function: Talk, report, rumor, saying CD. (archaic) An auxiliary which expresses dislike DS. AN auxiliary marking quotation, but expressing displeasure TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To return, to go back. 2. To come back, come again. 3. To turn around, to be turned upside down, to tumble down CD. 1. To return, to go back. 2. To be mistaken DK. (in some dialects) To fall down, collapse DS. 1. To come back. 2. To collapse, fall down TC.

Meaning: To be blind CD. To be blind, become blind DK. To be the correct amount, to be just right (of a number, measure &c.) DS. To be blind, to be unable to see having lost the power of vision. 2. To be the correct amount, to be just right TC.
Meaning: A verbal use of lod po 'relaxed'?.

Meaning: 1. To reach, arrive at. 2. To elapse, pass (in a general sense) CD. To receive, to get in hand, to reach DK. To arrive at a certain time DS. 1. To reach, arrive at, find. 2. To be the correct amount, to be just right (of a number). 3. To know, understand TC.
Meaning: To be able to take, seize, remove DS.
Meaning: 1. To know having studied. 2. To become accustomed, familiar DS. To know, become familiar with TC.
Meaning: To comb, curry (a horse) CD. To comb, brush, curry DK. To comb (hair, beard, &c.) DS. To comb TC.
Meaning: To plate (articles) with flattened metal DS.
Meaning: To draw, take out from within TC.
Meaning: To harrow (Sch.) CD. To harrow DK.
Meaning: To loosen knots, to set free DK.
Meaning: To be able CD.
Meaning: To stiffen, go stiff (of the body's limbs &c.) DS.
Meaning: To whisper (JÃ¤) CD. To whisper DK.
entry.note: Note: (JÃ¤) gives as an alternate of shub.

entry.trans: Meaning: (West) To drip through (JÃ¤) CD. To drip through DK.

entry.trans: Meaning: To be virtuous, to be auspicious DK. For good results to arrive DS.
Meaning: 1. To snore. 2. To hum, buzz (e.g. of a large beetle) (JÃ¤) CD.
Meaning: 1. (Central) To rub (one thing against each other). 2. To steal silently away, to sneak off (JÃ¤) CD. To rub, to apply friction to DK. 1. To grind. 2. To scrape, scrape off TC.
Meaning: To slide, slip DS.
Meaning: To whisper, speak in a low voice (JÃ¤) CD. To whisper DK. To speak softly DS.

entry.trans: Meaning: To follow the track of, to track DK.
Meaning: To butcher (Taube 1978: 198).

Meaning: To compare, to confront (Cs.) CD. To check, to count for checking DK. To think carefully, to examine again and again DS. 1. To discern true and false. 2. To research. 3. To mutually compare TC.
Meaning: To understand, know, comprehend DK. To be able to distinguish characteristics, to understand DS. To understand, know, comprehend TC.
Meaning: To exhort to come hither DS.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. (with terminative) To hold, contain, to have room in, on (JÃ¤). 2. To comprehend, hold in the mind CD. To have room in, to have capacity of, to be able to contain DK. To be able to fit inside DS. To be in, fit in TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To wait, defer, delay, prolong, postpone CD. To postpone, to feel lazy DK. 1. To postpone, delay. 2. To descend from, dismount DS. 1. To delay, cancel. 2. To dismount TC.
Meaning: 1. To tighten, become tight. 2. To influence, affect, and repeatedly return to the awareness. 3. To pummel, make fine through striking DS.
Meaning: To go in stages TC.

Meaning: To wash, to wash out, wash off, to clean by washing, to rinse (JÃ¤) CD. 1. To wash in water. 2. To drag, pull along DK. To purify (a smell &c.) using the power of water DS. 1. To wash. 2. To drag, pull TC.
Meaning: To soften, to make soft, to cause to smooth down, to cause to become friendly, cause to be friendly DK.

Meaning: To compare, to range (Sch.), to draw up in files (JÃ¤) CD. To cause to associate closely, to make stay together, to cause to line up DK. To arrange to things in a line DS. 1. To group together, arrange tightly. 2. To accompany, bring together, to ally TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: 1. To take off, pull off, peel, strip. 2. To copy CD. 1. To transcribe. 2. To peel DK. 1. To remove, tear off husk, skin. 2. To copy, transcribe a book DS. 1. To peel off, remove a skin, husk. 2. To copy, transcribe a book TC.
Meaning: (archaic) To sell (Cs.) CD. To pass on, to pass round, to give by hand, to pass on something internally DK. To sell something one owns without earning any profit TC.

Meaning: (behind a person's back [JÃ¤]) To rebuke, to blame, reproach (Cs.) (gshung) CD. (archaic) 1. To bring down, degrade, fall off, fall down. 2. To curse (bshung) CD. To backbite, to rebuke, curse in whisper DK. To bring down with words, insult, belittle DS. To insult, complain about secretly TC.
Meaning: To get scratched, excoriated, galled (cf. shun) (JÃ¤) CD. To injure the outer layer of skin through a scratch, scrape DS. To become swollen, numb from cold TC.
Meaning: To singe CD. To slightly burn new cloth in order to smooth down, clean DK. To make something thin DS. To burn the fluffy threads of a wool cloth in order to make it smooth TC.
Meaning: To abuse, revile CD. To scold, to abuse, to blame with angry words DK. To threaten, intimidate DS. To speak harsh words which insult, intimidate TC.

Meaning: (honorific) 1. To go away, depart. 2. To come, return, come back. 3. To die CD. 1. To go, proceed. 2. To give up. 3. To know DK. 1. To go. 2. (honorific) To die DS. 1. To go, leave. 2. To pass TC.
Meaning: To get wet, to moisten DK. To become wet with water DS.
Meaning: To ask for, beg for CD.

entry.trans: Meaning: To pour CD. 1. To prepare food. 2. To spill water DK. 1. For the power of water to make a trace in the ground. 2. To flow, pour down DS. To pour out TC.

Meaning: 1. To cleave, to break through. 2. To confess CD. To chop wood, to cut into halves, into pieces DK. 1. To shatter a round object into pieces. 2. To split into two or more fragments DS. To split into many pieces TC.

Meaning: To empty, remove, carry, take away CD. To increase the inside capacity, to enlarge the inside capacity DK. To take something out from inside (a cover, sheath &c) DS. To dig out, clear away TC.

entry.trans: Meaning: To kill, slay, murder, slaughter CD. To kill, to put to death DK. To cut off the continuity of a creature's life (e.g. men, cattle &c.) DS. 1. To cut off life, to kill. 2. To clear away, annihilate TC.
Meaning: To live, to be alive, to remain alive, to save, preserve one's own life CD. To be alive DK. To stay alive DS. To have life, to not deteriorate TC.
Meaning: To wake, to rouse from sleep by shaking, to urge on, to hurry on by force CD.
Meaning: 1. To fill out, fill up, to supply, complete, make up, to cure (wounds). 2. To pay, repay, return CD.
Meaning: To brandish, flourish CD. To wave, swing an axe, sickle &c. with the hand DS. To brandish, raise, flourish TC.
Meaning: To get ready for substitute, to substitute [sic] DK. To organize (articles &c.) in rows DS. To prepare, take out TC.

Meaning: 1. To ask for, to beg for. 2. (honorific) To dress, to put on. 3. To eat, drink, to take a meal, offer a meal CD. 1. (honorific) To use (food, drink &c.), to wear (wool &c.). 2. (suffixed to some verbs) To ask someone to establish one's wish, hope. 3. To ask, to say DS. 1. To request, to offer. 2. To eat, drink, wear TC. (mchid gsol pa) To send a letter (from a person of lower rank to a person of higher rank) (Takeuchi 1990b: 183).
Meaning: To make known by trumpet or drum CD.
Meaning: To mend, repair CD.
Meaning: (in West) To sip (JÃ¤) CD.

Meaning: 1. To cool. 2. (honorific) To wash CD. 1. To cut hair. 2. To wash, clean feet &c. 3. To take off one's shoes &c. 4. To cool DK. 1. To wash. 2. To shear, shave. 3. To give off, shed. 4. (dialect) To doff, take of (clothes) TC.

wrII.label: Past:
wrII.ref: LZ, CD, ND, DK, DS, TC.

example.label: Characteristic Example:
example.orth: mgron po sogs dang sngon du

entry.trans: Meaning: To go to meet CD. To invite, to welcome, to receive guests DK. To go before a guest, ask about heath, make welcome &c. to show happiness DS. To invite TC.
entry.note: Note: Compare brtsu, an archaic form of this verb.

entry.trans: Meaning: To come from one side, to come across one's way (Sch.), to come into collision with CD.
Meaning: To revive, spirit, to awaken, rouse CD.
Meaning: To cherish, take care of, be greedy, avaricious DS.
Meaning: To be happy, delighted CD.
Meaning: To separate, sort, choose CD.
Meaning: 1. To pant, gasp. 2. To squander, dissipate (JÃ¤) CD. To be surprised, to be shocked DK.
Meaning: To be surprised, taken back, to deteriorate mentally DS.
Meaning: To laugh sneeringly CD. To take by snatching away, to plunder DK.
Meaning: To be too fast to act, to be very hasty DK. To open a hole larger DS.
Meaning: To pant, wheeze, snort (JÃ¤) CD. To have rough, short breath with the mouth open DS. (dialect) To breath with difficulty TC.
Meaning: (West) To exaggerate, to talk big, to brag (JÃ¤) CD. To be very fast breathing DK.
entry.note: Note:(Hoshi 2003)gives this verb as an alternate of hal.

entry.trans: Meaning: To be quick, active, dexterous CD.
Meaning: (West) To fall away, to shrink, to shrivel (JÃ¤) CD.
Meaning: To loosen soil (JÃ¤) CD. For the soil of fields to become soft DS.
Meaning: To require more and more (JÃ¤) CD. To be highly efficient (Hoshi 2003).
Meaning: 1. To thrust, to push violently, to stem firmly. 2. To scratch. 3. To exert one's self (JÃ¤) CD.
Meaning: To rend, tear up, tear to pieces (JÃ¤) CD. To exaggerate, to make, become spacious lines DK.
Meaning: (in West) To hang (a thief) (JÃ¤) CD.
Meaning: 1. To become evil. 2. To stiffen. 3. To coagulate TC.
Meaning: To break, smash (Sch.) CD.
entry.note: Note:(Hahn 1999: 124) suggests this comes from the same root as the adjective krum pa (< g + rum) 'broken'.

entry.trans: Meaning: To be worn out, to become too old, to decay DK.
Meaning: To become, be single DK.
Meaning: To become dry DK.
Meaning: To soften, slough, suppurate CD.
Meaning: To remain as a surplus of CD. 1. To be left, remain behind. 2. To exceed a certain measure TC.
Meaning: To approach, to meet, to assemble with other persons CD. To come, approach forcefully DK. To arrive, come DS. To arrive TC.
Meaning: To be together (Tournadre & Dorje 2003: 368).
Meaning: To twist, plait, braid, weave CD. To plait, weave DS.
entry.note: Note: Compare with sle and sla.

example.label: Characteristic Example:
example.orth: rta dang g.yang sa sogs su

entry.trans: Meaning: To fall down DK. To drop, fall TC.
Meaning: To be successful, to be accomplished DK. 1. To arrive at and enter into. 2. To be able to stand on its own TC.
Meaning: To be at ease, carefree (in though or action) DS. To loosen, relax, slacken TC.
Meaning: To return, give pay back CD. 1. To join, place, contact, one thing on another thing. 2. To send a reply, to harm in return for a reply which harms DS. To come, arrive to the ear TC.
